title: Savings
text: “An account (as in a bank) on which interest is usually paid and from which withdrawals can be made usually only by presentation of a passbook or by written authorization on a prescribed form.”

title: Current or checking account
text: “A bank account from which a person can take money by writing checks: checking account”

title: Fixed Deposit
text: “An arrangement with a bank in which you leave your money in an account for a particular length of time, in order to get a higher rate of interest that is fixed”

title: Recurring Deposit
text: “An arrangement with a bank in which you have a savings plan to deposit a fixed amount of money every month for a specified period.”

title: Mutual Funds
text: “An open-end investment company that invests money of its shareholders in a usually diversified group of securities of other corporations”
